task_structure.input: Analyze live turbine data, adjust settings within safety constraints, monitor the results, and report performance improvements to optimize wind farm operations.

subtasks.input: Gather real-time sensor readings, power output metrics, and environmental conditions from all turbines in the farm using IoT monitoring systems.
Process collected data using statistical analysis and machine learning models to identify patterns indicating suboptimal performance or mechanical stress points.
Cross-reference identified adjustment parameters with safety protocols, regulatory limits, and equipment specifications to ensure compliance.
Modify blade pitch angles, yaw alignment, and rotational speed parameters within approved safety margins to optimize energy capture efficiency.
Collect real-time data on the turbine's current operational parameters including blade pitch angles, yaw alignment deviation, and rotational speed.
Access turbine operational safety specifications to confirm allowable ranges for blade pitch angles, yaw alignment deviation, and rotational speed.
Apply a validated energy capture optimization algorithm to determine target blade pitch angles, yaw alignment, and rotational speed within safety constraints.
Implement blade pitch angle changes using turbine control systems to reach target values while monitoring actuator response and safety limits.
Adjust turbine yaw alignment to the target orientation using yaw motors while verifying position sensors and collision avoidance systems.
Adjust turbine rotational speed to the calculated optimal RPM through generator torque control while monitoring drivetrain stress indicators.
Validate that all adjusted parameters remain within safety margins and confirm energy capture efficiency improvements through power output monitoring.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) including power output, vibration levels, and temperature metrics for 72 hours following adjustments.
Quantify performance improvements by statistically analyzing energy production efficiency, maintenance alerts reduction, and mechanical stress indicators.
Gather baseline energy output metrics from sensors or logs before any improvements were implemented
Measure energy output after implementing improvements using identical methods as baseline collection
Compile historical records of equipment alerts/fault codes from maintenance systems for both pre- and post-improvement periods
Collect vibration, temperature, and load measurements from equipment sensors during normal operation periods
Handle missing values, remove outliers, and standardize measurement units across all data sources
Apply paired t-tests for energy efficiency comparison and chi-square tests for alert frequency reduction
Compute Cohen's d for continuous metrics and Cramer's V for categorical alert data to quantify improvement magnitude
Calculate 95% confidence intervals for all measured performance improvements
Develop box plots for energy efficiency, line charts for alert trends, and heatmaps for stress indicators
Document analysis methods, results, and practical significance in a structured format with executive summary
Compile findings into a comprehensive report featuring visualizations of performance gains, cost savings estimates, and recommendations for future adjustments.
